Better Cities

FixMyStreet, MapIt, and Mapumental are all technologies that help people take control in their own neighbourhoods ‚Äî or power sites that do.

Reports 212,383

FixMyStreet.com reports made this year

FixMyStreet sites 15

Installed and deployed worldwide - see them here.

Mapit Lookups per week 1,000,000

Our geographic points-to-boundaries API helps power a lot of projects across the web.

Going Pro

This year, we launched a new, vastly-improved service for councils: FixMyStreet Pro.

Built in consultation with the authorities that will use it, FixMyStreet Pro now plugs directly into whatever systems the council already has in place, and offers a wealth of new council-friendly features, while still making sure the front end is as user-friendly as ever for those doing the reporting.

The Archers love it

Thanks to FixMyStreet Borsetshire, there‚Äôs somewhere to report those blocked culverts and distressed sheep.

Bots? Not quite so much

Dave‚Äôs experiments with Machine Learning reassured us that robots won‚Äôt be replacing our users just yet.

Self-service APIs

We also made MapIt much easier to use, with simpler payments and a self-service checkout.

Milestones

Happy birthday FixMyStreet! The nation‚Äôs favourite fault-reporting service turned ten years old in February, and just five months later we were marking its millionth report.

Trials transparency

Ben Goldacre, of Bad Science fame, believes all clinical trials should publish their results. We gave his campaign a helping hand.

Number of FixMyStreet reports about dog mess that went into Alex‚Äôs paper 20,000

One of the "interesting" side effects of FixMyStreet is a database of places people have reported dog poop (or "dog fouling" as it tends to be called academically). We now have over 20,000 locations across the UK where nature's call has both been heard, and reported.
